result.execSummary:
The defendant Kasundra L Bays was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's as well as DNA surcharge. Court waived all applicable court costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and the domestic violence surcharge. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Violent Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling for victims of domestic abuse.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
- Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
- Obtain/maintain employment, assist with vocational training.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kasundra L Bays

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kasundra L Bays in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Kasundra L Bays in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.   Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements by: Mary C. (defendant's mother).   
Defendant sentenced to serve 3 months in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review before the court.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling for victims of domestic abuse.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and the domestic violence surcharge.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections as well as DNA surcharges and provide a DNA sample.
-Obtain and maintain employment, assist with vocational training.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no violent contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-21-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kasundra L Bays in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.   Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including the No Contact Order.
Jury trial is vacted.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated August 3, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Kasundra L Bays in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Paul R.  
Third party contact ia Mr. R.;s family for purposes of arranging child visits.

Defendant Kasundra L Bays in court with attorney Bernard S. Stein.  Defendant Kasundra L Bays in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
